Class BigTwoClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • BigTwoClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CardGame, NetworkGame

    public class BigTwoClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements CardGame, NetworkGame
    This class models a Big Two card client.
    Author:
    Hu Qiyun

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BigTwoClient.ServerHandler
      This class reads incoming messages from the server

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BigTwoClient()
      Constructor of BigTwo, it creates 4 players and add them to the list of players, and create a Big Two table which builds the GUI for the game and handles user actions.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkMove(int playerID, int[] cardIdx)
      Checks the move made by the player, This method should be called from the parseMessage() method when a message of the type MOVE is received from the game server.

      This method returns a valid hand from the specified list of cards of the player or null.

      Makes a network connection to the server.
      void makeMove(int playerID, int[] cardIdx)
      This method makes a move by a player with the specified playerID using the cards specified by the list of indices, this method should be called from the BigTwoTable when the active player presses either the “Play” or “Pass” button.

      • distributeCards

        public void distributeCards(Deck deck)
        This method distributes a shuffled deck of cards to the four players and choose the player who is holding Diamond 3 should start the game.
        Parameters:
        deck - A shuffled deck of cards which will be used in the game, we will distribute cards to the four players.

      • start

        public void start(Deck deck)
        This method starts/restarts the game with a given shuffled deck of cards, it removes all cards from the players and table, distribute the cards to the players, also identify the player who should make the first move.
        Specified by:
        start in interface CardGame
        Parameters:
        deck - The deck of (shuffled) cards to be used in this game.
        See Also:
        CardGame.start(Deck deck)

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(int playerID,
                     int[] cardIdx)
        This method makes a move by a player with the specified playerID using the cards specified by the list of indices, this method should be called from the BigTwoTable when the active player presses either the “Play” or “Pass” button.
        Specified by:
        makeMove in interface CardGame
        Parameters:
        playerID - the playerID of the player who makes the move
        cardIdx - the list of the indices of the cards selected by the player
        See Also:
        CardGame.makeMove(int playerID, int[] cardIdx)

      • checkMove

        public void checkMove(int playerID,
                      int[] cardIdx)
        Checks the move made by the player, This method should be called from the parseMessage() method when a message of the type MOVE is received from the game server. if the move is legal, we finish this move and print out the information to the message area, if not legal, we let the player move again until it is legal.
        Specified by:
        checkMove in interface CardGame
        Parameters:
        playerID - the playerID of the player who makes the move
        cardIdx - the list of the indices of the cards selected by the player CardGame#checkMove(int playerID, int[] cardIdx)

      • composeHand

        public Hand composeHand(CardGamePlayer player,
                        CardList cards)
        This method returns a valid hand from the specified list of cards of the player or null.
        Parameters:
        player - The CardGamePlayer being inspected.
        cards - The cards selected by the player CardGamePlayer.
        Returns:
        A valid Hand from the specified list of cards of the player, or null if there is no valid Hand.
